snippet: The cable provider reported a third-quarter loss, and its shares fell more than 6 percent as investors worried about a decline in video customers and the financial impact of Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Cablevision Systems reports third-quarter loss and its shares fall more than 6 percent as investors worry about a decline in video customers and the financial impact of Hurricane Sandy; posts loss of $3.8 million, or 1 cent a share, compared with a profit of $39.3 million, or 14 cents a share, in the year-earlier quarter; revenue rose to $1.69 billion from $1.67 billion a year ago, meeting analysts’ expectations.
lead_paragraph: The cable provider reported a third-quarter loss, and its shares fell more than 6 percent as investors worried about a decline in video customers and the financial impact of Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: Cablevision Posts Loss as Hurricane Sandy Costs Worry Customers
headline.main: Cablevision Shares Fall on Worries About Storm’s Costs
headline.print_headline: Cablevision Shares Fall on Worries About Storm’s Costs
